results.title: Green grows the Mallee
results.brief_description: Describes the work of the Pomona Experimental Farm at Murrayville in Victoria, in the use of underground water. Bores were sunk and yielded ample water but problems had still to be overcome in the preparation of the irrigation area. The manufacturing processes of the Pomona Deep Well Turbine pump illustrate the care and engineering precision in the production assembly and testing of the pump units. Irrigation scheme using bore water provide Mallee farmers with security against the threat of drought.

results.title: Green Gold
results.brief_description: The setting of this film is a small community of farmers who make their living not only from the land but also from the forest. We see many of the complicated links in the chain that brings the products of this forest to the consumer, including transport, milling and processing., The various uses of timber are described. But forests cannot be mined, as can metal deposits. Tress are a crop like any other and must be carefully planted, tended and protected against pests, fires and indiscriminate cutting. At a timber conference, experts of the Food and Agriculture Organization seek a lasting solution to the problem of timber shortage. Unexplored areas of forest resources must be tapped; cultivated forests must be conserved. New machines and techniques will also help in processing and developing the products, Co-operation is the only real chance for world-wide progress in conservation.

results.title: Green glory
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and Mushir Ahmad
results.brief_description: India has vast forest wealth, which has been steadily reduced by reckless felling. Now a vigorous effort is being made in conservation and afforestation to increase the national wealth.

results.title: Green garden country
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and Conon Fraser
results.brief_description: From parks and public gardens to the backyard enthusiast, this film shows how New Zealand’s extraordinary variety of shrubs and flowers from all parts of the world contribute to an enviable way of life in New Zealand.

results.title: Green engineering: simple solutions to water pollution
results.creator_credit: Film Victoria, Environment Protection Authority and Stephen Cozens
results.brief_description: Using the Yarra River as an example, this video shows how sediment pollution of rivers can be reduced by using green engineering and how silt traps at building sites can be useful on eroded sites.

results.title: Green ceilings of Borneo
results.brief_description: In the dense tree-tops of the Borneo jungle, animals have adapted to the problem of getting from one tree-top to another without climbing down. This shows gliding lizards, squirrels, snakes, orang-utan and a large fruit bat.

results.title: Green buds of hope
results.brief_description: Child welfare facilities in post war Poland; effect of such services on child mortality figures; new baby clinics established in city areas; mobile clinic units, creches, and activities in the country’s 7000 nursery schools, where children receive free medical and dental attention; during vacations, holidays are organized and children from Warsaw and Krakow visit the mountains or the seaside.

results.title: Green animation
results.creator_credit: World Wildlife Fund, Sally Richardson and Claire Breese
results.brief_description: Tony Robinson, (Baldrick in Blackadder), and Aardman animator Peter Lord introduce a compilation of short animated films by student and professional animators which emphasise the need to care for our fragile planet and its resources. The aim is to make us think, rather than to preach, and as such would be a valuable resource in environmental education. Divided into three parts, the first sets the scene as we voyage through time and space. Part two emphasises the finiteness of resources and is full of anger, irony, fear and rampaging trees. Part three moves away from an implied pessimism to show us the light at the end of the tunnel with crazy notions of simplicity, moderation and reforestation as part of a global solution. The commentary by the two hosts provides an insight into the animation processes and the range of techniques and styles. The messages are often simple and swift, but they leave a lasting impression.
